other_tests.procedure_name: Surgery (L3â€“5 pedicle screw posterior fixation and laminectomy)
other_tests.findings: Chronic low-back pain and intermittent left-sided sciatica. Neurological status improved postoperatively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Sequelae were limited to intermittent lumbar backache and moderate left-sided sciatica.

other_tests.findings: Postoperative lumbar symptoms improved; patient was free of lumbar symptoms after one month.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Intermittent left-sided sciatica was spontaneously relieved.

other_tests.findings: Normal muscle strength; spinal radiography revealed correct interbody graft fusion.
Intradural, periradicular ossifications at L-4; suggested previous dural sac opening with enlarged subarachnoid space.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Calcifications were extensive and sheathed the nerve roots, but symptoms were mild and well controlled.

other_tests.findings: Gadolinium-enhanced T1-weighted imaging showed pathological intradural periradicular enhancement below L-4; T2-weighted imaging demonstrated a heterogeneous intradural hyposignal caudally.
